string-array.name: char_array
string-array.item: John Worthing, J.P.
Algernon Moncrieff
Rev. Canon Chasuble, D.D.
Merriman, Butler
Lane, Manservant
Lady Bracknell
Hon. Gwendolen Fairfax
Cecily Cardew
Miss Prism, Governess

string-array.name: act_array
string-array.item: Act I
Act II
Act III

string-array.name: act1_array
string-array.item: 1 - Algernon: Did you hear what I was playing, Lane?
2 - Algernon: I believe it is customary in good society...
3 - Jack: Why on earth do you say that?
4 - Algernon: Yes. But why does your aunt call...
5 - Jack: That wouldn’t be at all a bad thing.
6 - Jack: I suppose so, if you want to.
7 - Algernon: It is a great bore, and, I need...
8 - Jack: You really love me, Gwendolen?
9 - Gwendolen: Yes, but men often propose for practice.
10 - Lady Bracknell: That is satisfactory.
11 - Jack: In the cloak-room at Victoria Station.
12 - Jack: Is that clever?
13 - Algernon: Well, I’m hungry.
14 - Gwendolen: Good! Algy, you may turn round now.

string-array.name: act2_array
string-array.item: 15 - Miss Prism: Cecily, Cecily! Surely such a utilitarian...
16 - Miss Prism: The good ended happily, and the bad unhappily.
17 - Cecily: Ask Mr. Ernest Worthing to come here.
18 - Cecily: I’m afraid I’ve no time, this afternoon.
19 - Miss Prism: Mr. Worthing!
20 - Miss Prism: People who live entirely for pleasure usually are.
21 - Jack: Good heavens!
22 - Algernon: I am afraid I can’t stay more than a week this time.
23 - Algernon: Thank you.
24 - Algernon: Darling! And when was the engagement actually settled?
25 - Cecily: But I don’t like the name of Algernon.
26 - Cecily: How nice of you to like me so much after...
27 - Cecily: I beg your pardon, Gwendolen, did you say Ernest?
28 - Cecily: Yes, as usual.
29 - Jack: To dear little Cecily! Of course not!
30 - Jack: Gwendolen—Cecily—it is very painful for me...
31 - Jack: How can you sit there, calmly eating muffins...
32 - Jack: Algernon! I have already told you to go.

string-array.name: act3_array
string-array.item: 33 - Gwendolen: The fact that they did not follow us...
34 - Cecily: Could we not both speak at the same time?
35 - Lady Bracknell: What did he die of?
36 - Jack: And after six months nobody knew her.
37 - Lady Bracknell: Ahem! Mr. Worthing, after careful consideration...
38 - Lady Bracknell: That is not the destiny I propose for Gwendolen.
39 - Miss Prism: Lady Bracknell, I admit with shame that I do not know.
40 - Miss Prism: You?
41 - Lady Bracknell: The General was essentially a man of peace...
